result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin R Witkowiak

records.addlTxt:
8:16 AM Defendant Justin R Witkowiak in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Justin R Witkowiak.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store or any place that sells alcohol by the glass. Court will allow an exeption to this rule between 5:00 pm on 9/16/22 to 12:01 am on 9/18/22 to allow him to attend a wedding.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle during the pendency of the case.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM. The Defendant to report to WCS within one (1) business day of being released.

11:12 AM Defendant Justin R Witkowiak in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Justin R Witkowiak.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for motion to modify bail.
Arguments by the Defense.
State does not have a specific position on the request.
Court grants request and orders conditions of bond modified to allow an exception to the condition: Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store or any place that sells alcohol by the glass. Court will allow an exeption to this rule between 5:00 pm on 9/16/22 to 12:01 am on 9/18/22 to allow him to attend a wedding.
Preliminary hearing set for 10/21/22 to remain on the Court Commissioner's calendar as previously scheduled.
Bail/bond hearing on September 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail;  filed by Atty. Mark Kershek
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

3:31 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Justin R Witkowiak in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Justin R Witkowiak. Attorney appears as friend of the court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived. 
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
